summary: Completed comprehensive frontend testing of cinematic ocean descent scroll-driven experience. All core functionality working correctly.
passed_tests: Title section loads with 'How Deep Is the Ocean... Really?' heading
Scroll indicator 'Scroll to descend' visible and properly positioned
Depth gauge shows updating depth counter and 'YOU ARE HERE' label
Audio toggle starts muted (VolumeX), changes to Volume2 on click
49 METERS DEEP section with depth marker and dotted line
Marine creatures visible with ALL CAPS labels (CORAL REEF, STRIPED BASS, CLOWN FISH, BARRAMUNDI)
Creature hover tooltips display educational facts
1,000 METERS DEEP section with 'THE MIDNIGHT ZONE' subtitle
10,984 METERS DEEP - Mariana Trench section with depth marker
All three ending texts present: 'deepest known point', 'explored more of Mars', 'Earth's last frontier'
'Explore Another Wonder' restart button scrolls back to surface
Background color transitions from bright blue (30,144,210) to near-black (0,0,0)
Particle canvas with floating specks visible throughout experience
Bioluminescent creatures (jellyfish, anglerfish) have glow effects
Anglerfish lure has pulsing animation effect
Scroll-triggered animations working smoothly with Framer Motion
SVG marine creature illustrations rendering correctly
Web Audio API ambient sound functionality working
All data-testid attributes implemented for robust testing
success_percentage: frontend: 100% - All 19 tested features working correctly
